Helpers

Class FileHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • Helpers.FileHelper

  • public abstract class FileHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Adds functionality to the File class by adding a few helpful methods. All methods are accessed statically, and therefore independently from any one File object.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Garrett Stonis

    • Method Detail

      • copyDirectory

        public static boolean copyDirectory(java.lang.String sourceString,
                                    java.lang.String targetString)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Copies a given directory and all of its contents to another directory. If the target directory does not exist, it will be created, along with any directories needed for it to be created.

        If the name of the target directory is not the same as the source directory, the source is essentially copied into a new name.

        Maximum individual file-size to copy, in the directory's contents, is 2,147,483,647 bytes (roughly 2Gb).

        Parameters:
        sourceString - The String object containing the path of the source directory.
        targetString - The String object containing the path of the target directory.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the copy was successful.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception Thrown if copying files has failed.

      • copyDirectory

        public static boolean copyDirectory(java.io.File source,
                                    java.io.File target)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Copies a given directory and all of its contents to another directory. If the target directory does not exist, it will be created, along with any directories needed for it to be created.

        If the name of the target directory is not the same as the source directory, the source is essentially copied into a new name.

        Maximum individual file-size to copy, in the directory's contents, is 2,147,483,647 bytes (roughly 2Gb).

        Parameters:
        source - The File object containing the path of the source directory.
        target - The File object containing the path of the target directory.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the copy was successful.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if copying files has failed.

      • copyFile

        public static boolean copyFile(java.lang.String fileString,
                               java.lang.String targetString)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Copies a given file to a given target file. If the target file does not exist, it will be created, along with any directories needed for it to be created. Overwrites any files with same name in the target file's directory.

        Maximum file-size to copy is 2,147,483,647 bytes (roughly 2Gb).

        Parameters:
        fileString - The String object containing the path of the desired file to copy.
        targetString - The String object containing the path of the target file.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the copy was successful.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown in the case that the "file" file isn't found or target file couldn't be created.

      • copyFile

        public static boolean copyFile(java.io.File file,
                               java.io.File target)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Copies a given file to a given target file. If the target file does not exist, it will be created, along with any directories needed for it to be created. Overwrites any files with same name in the target file's directory.

        Maximum file-size to copy is 2,147,483,647 bytes (roughly 2Gb).

        Parameters:
        file - The File object containing the path of the desired file to copy.
        target - The File object containing the path of the target file.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the copy was successful.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown in the case that the "file" file isn't found or target file couldn't be created.

      • getFileLocation

        public static java.lang.String getFileLocation(java.io.File file)
        Gets the path of a file/directory WITHOUT the file/directory included. The final '/' or '\', however, will be kept.
        Parameters:
        file - File object containing the desired path.
        Returns:
        String object that contains the path of a given file/directory WITHOUT the file/directory.

      • getFileLocation

        public static java.lang.String getFileLocation(java.lang.String fileString)
        Gets the path of a file/directory WITHOUT the file/directory included. The final '/' or '\', however, will be kept.
        Parameters:
        fileString - String object containing the desired path.
        Returns:
        String object that contains the path of a given file/directory WITHOUT the file/directory.

      • forceCreateDirectory

        public static boolean forceCreateDirectory(java.lang.String path)
        Forcibly creates a directory, as well as any directories needed for the directory to be created. Will only fail if the path contains an illegal character, or the path already exists (including it leading to a file).
        Parameters:
        path - String object containing the path of the directory desired to be created.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the directory was successfully created.

      • forceCreateDirectory

        public static boolean forceCreateDirectory(java.io.File pathFile)
        Forcibly creates a directory, as well as any directories needed for the directory to be created. Will only fail if the path contains an illegal character, or the path already exists (including it leading to a file).
        Parameters:
        pathFile - File object containing the path of the directory desired to be created.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the directory was successfully created.

      • forceDeleteDirectory

        public static boolean forceDeleteDirectory(java.lang.String path)
        Forcibly deletes a directory (or a file), despite any sub-directories or sub-files.

        Cannot be undone.

        Parameters:
        path - String object containing the path to delete.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the delete was successful.

      • forceDeleteDirectory

        public static boolean forceDeleteDirectory(java.io.File pathFile)
        Forcibly deletes a directory (or a file), despite any sub-directories or sub-files.

        Cannot be undone.

        Parameters:
        pathFile - File object containing the path to delete.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the delete was successful.

      • zip

        public static boolean zip(java.lang.String fileToZip,
                          java.lang.String zipLocation)
        Zips the given file/directory into a .zip file.

        Note that if the zipping fails, there will likely still be a .zip file created, and it will be corrupted.

        File-reading is handled with a by-file-size buffer, meaning that the zipping process is optimized to be as fast as possible, but suffers from high memory usage if any files in the target are large.

        Parameters:
        fileToZip - String object containing the path of the file/directory to zip.
        zipLocation - String object containing the desired path for the .zip file.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the zip was successful.

      • zip

        public static boolean zip(java.io.File fileToZip,
                          java.io.File zipLocation)
        Zips the given file/directory into a .zip file.

        Note that if the zipping fails, there will likely still be a .zip file created, and it will be corrupted.

        File-reading is handled with a by-file-size buffer, meaning that the zipping process is optimized to be as fast as possible, but suffers from high memory usage if any files in the target are large.

        Parameters:
        fileToZip - File object containing the path of the file/directory to zip.
        zipLocation - File object containing the desired path for the .zip file.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the zip was successful.

      • zip

        public static boolean zip(java.lang.String fileToZip,
                          java.lang.String zipLocation,
                          int bufferSize)
        Zips the given file/directory into a .zip file.

        Note that if the zipping fails, there will likely still be a .zip file created, and it will be corrupted.

        Parameters:
        fileToZip - String object containing the path of the file/directory to zip.
        zipLocation - String object containing the desired path for the .zip file.
        bufferSize - The size of the buffer for file-reading. Larger values make the zipping faster, but take more RAM to complete. 1024 is a great intermediate value.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the zip was successful.

      • zip

        public static boolean zip(java.io.File fileToZip,
                          java.io.File zipLocation,
                          int bufferSize)
        Zips the given file/directory into a .zip file.

        Note that if the zipping fails, there will likely still be a .zip file created, and it will be corrupted.

        Parameters:
        fileToZip - File object containing the path of the file/directory to zip.
        zipLocation - File object containing the desired path for the .zip file.
        bufferSize - The size of the buffer for file-reading. Larger values make the zipping faster, but take more RAM to complete. 1024 is a great intermediate value.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the zip was successful.
